etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Watts (1815–1884), chemist. From picro- + ancient Greek μεριδ-, μερίς part, after Italian Picromeride

definitions: A mineral that is a sulphate of magnesium and potassium, K₂ Mg(SO₄)₂ ·6H₂ O, crystallizing in the monoclinic system and usually occurring as colourless or white masses and crusts.
